job_tasks.phrase: building Software Solutions to enable our internal and external clients.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core activity of creating software for clients, which falls under traditional software development.

job_tasks.phrase: gather requirements, define the architecture, manage the development and deployment of Software solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This outlines the full software development lifecycle, from planning to deployment, which is a core software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Working on Internal tool development and external client projects;
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions the development of tools and projects, which are standard software engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Working as part of Agile development teams;
job_tasks.justification: Working in Agile teams is a common practice in modern software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Managing the development and deployment of software solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the operational aspects of software delivery, fitting under software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Building web applications or work on Data Analysis projects using Python (FastAPI, Django), Javascript (React) and SQL and NoSQL;
job_tasks.justification: This describes the creation of web applications and data analysis projects using standard web development and data technologies.

job_tasks.phrase: Learning and using git for version control;
job_tasks.justification: Git is a fundamental tool for version control in software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Completing the documentation tasks as expected by the Project / Product team;
job_tasks.justification: Documentation is an integral part of the software development process.

job_tasks.phrase: As you work on Projects / Products you are expected to learn the Business / Accounting / Finance concepts expected of the Project / Product;
job_tasks.justification: This task requires understanding business concepts to effectively deliver software solutions, aligning with business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: work with in multidisciplinary teams (including deals & technical accounting experts, ERP & technology specialists, software developers and data analysts)
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need to collaborate with diverse teams, which is a key aspect of communication and collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: Coaching colleagues in the areas of personal growth and development of various consulting skills.
job_tasks.justification: Coaching colleagues involves communication, guidance, and skill development, fitting under communication and collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: continuously invest globally in the development of our team members, our skills and the innovative tools that we use
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes continuous learning and skill development, which aligns with the learning and adaptability category.

job_tasks.phrase: You are motivated to complete the onboarding training of the team (Technical & Non-Technical) on time.
job_tasks.justification: Completing onboarding training demonstrates a commitment to learning and adapting to the team's environment and tools.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on traditional software development tasks, including building web applications, internal tools, and client projects using standard programming languages and frameworks like Python, JavaScript, and SQL. There is no mention of AI/ML models, generative AI, or related specialized tasks. The role emphasizes software lifecycle management, agile methodologies, and collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, all of which fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering). Therefore, the profile is 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the required tasks and technologies. It explicitly details traditional software development activities and does not mention any AI or ML specific responsibilities, making the classification straightforward.
